Herein, we present a study of such phases prepared from Ta 3N 5 and binary nitrides A 3N 2 (A: Mg, Ca) instead of the alkaline earth amides as reactants, and determination of the crystal structure for the calcium compound. The feasibility of Ca and Mg ion extraction from CaTaN 2, MgTa 2N 3, and Mg
x Ta 2N 4 was studied both chemically and electrochemically. Finally, in light of the results achieved, the feasibility of Ca deintercalation form CaTaN 2 is also investigated using first principles calculations within the density functional theory (DFT) approximation.
